definition: to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: Because your minds are compatible, you are able to understand each other much more quickly than you would otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你們的想法搭調，所以比平時能更快地理解對方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a light blue shirt that just matched her car.
sentences.chinese: 她身着一件淺藍色的襯衫，和她的車顏色很搭調。

sentences.english: Rose's clothes and hat don't match.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯的衣服和帽子不搭調。

sentences.english: You know certain things doesn'tgo uh with other things aesthetically.
sentences.chinese: 你知道有些東西和別的東西就美學而言是不搭調的。

sentences.english: The city itself is kind of like a small town with tourism tagged onto it.
sentences.chinese: 這個城市其實就是個小鎮，旅遊業似乎與它並不搭調。

sentences.english: This is a very nice sketch, but the style is not approprite for our game.
sentences.chinese: 這個草圖很好，但是風格同我們的遊戲不搭調。

sentences.english: And bear in mind that I have myself been known to wear non-matching accessories in my time.
sentences.chinese: 反正我記得我以佩戴不搭調的配飾而出名。
